author: Alex Hormozi
text: More potential is wasted through inaction than incompetence.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The best content to consume to learn entrepreneurship is reality.

You‚Äôll learn more from your first 100 cold calls than you will from reading every sales book in the world.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: On discipline: If you want to get to where you want to go, your frustration tolerance has to get stronger. And the good news, is that's a skill, which means you can get better at it.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
More only works if you have feedback loops to get better.

More for the sake of more doesn't move the needle.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The higher you go. The better you are, the better the opportunities you have to say no to.

You feel regret because you‚Äôre imagining the upside of the path you didn't take but not the downside you didn't get.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You can lose more than you win as long as when you win, you win big.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
If you are under $1m/year, you have to advertise more.

No one knows you exist‚Ä¶ which is why you're not making as much as you want.

You're not fighting against competition , you're fighting against irrelevance.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The person with the longest time horizon usually wins.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
I have yet to meet a successful person who says that it was faster and easier than they expected.

Even when you expect it to take a long time and be hard, you're still undershooting.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Short deadlines. Long time horizons.

This is the way.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You cannot beat someone who has already decided they will do whatever it takes for as long as it takes.

And that person might as well be you.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
It always costs more, takes longer and is harder than you think it will be.

Even when you know it always costs more, takes longer and is harder than you think it will be.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Entrepreneurship is one of the greatest vehicles of personal development because it forces you to confront every weakness you‚Äôve been avoiding.

The market won‚Äôt let you hide from yourself. 10 out of 10 times, the person limiting the business is you.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Poor people are impressed by stuff.
Rich people are impressed by results.

Don't outspend. Outwork.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Don't buy the lambo to promote yourself. You'll only impress poor people. Which is most people. But not the ones with money. They're the ones you want. And they only wanna see you outwork everyone, not outspend everyone.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Cheap advertising hack:

Take every shirt you already own to a screen printer and get your logo printed on them.

You wear clothes every day anyway. Might as well rep your own brand rather than be free advertising for someone else's.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You can‚Äôt have main character energy with side character goals.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
What success is for you when you‚Äôre 20 will be different when you‚Äôre 30 and when you‚Äôre 40. You‚Äôre just pursuing something else now‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôs okay.

It‚Äôs okay to change your mind.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Brutal truth: You‚Äôre living too much in the future, and that‚Äôs limiting your growth.

There is nothing more indicative of future success than the ability to ignore what could happen tomorrow and focus on what needs to happen today.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Strategy is not eliminating problems, it's deciding which ones to focus on - which means some shit will always be fucked.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Most small businesses, don't need more ideas, they need more execution.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Either sell extremely expensive to a select few or sell something super cheap to everyone. The middle is where people die.

Revista Capital

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Most people get more rewarded for talking about their goals than going after them.

Which is why most people stay stuck and never start.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The specificity of the request is inversely correlated with the skill of the recipient.

If someone sucks, you gotta tell them exactly what to do. If they're good, you can just tell them what you want to have happen, and they'll make it happen.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Figuring things out is a wandering behavior. But people do really terribly with uncertainty.

That's why entrepreneurs get compensated so highly - because they take on more risk.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Poor people stay poor because they want a fast way to get rich.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You'd be surprised how far you can get by only knowing what you want and not accepting anything else until you get it.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Focusing on many things is a great way to fill your calendar and empty your bank account.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: People get stuck when they realize what they want costs way more than they expected - but they don't stop wanting it.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You feel stuck because you figured out success costs way more than you expected - and you're not sure if you want it as much as the things you'd have to trade for it. And that's okay.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If you're in your 20s and want to stand out, do what you say you‚Äôre going to do even if no one is there to give you applause.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
'Obsessed' is just a word people use to describe the price winners pay to win.

Frame0

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You feel stuck because you think you deserve balance.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The fastest way to stand out is to put in more effort than everyone else.

Show up early. Use names. Do your research ahead of time. Smile when you greet people. Do more than your share. Follow up quickly.

Work ethic is the universal currency of respect. And it costs you nothing

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
No matter what self help gurus say: if you need applause to do your work, you‚Äôre never going to win. You'll always lose to someone who sees the work as the reward.

Tanda 3: Alex Hormozi
@AlexHormozi
¬∑
Oct 24
The average American is overweight, divorced, and in debt.

It's okay to feel like you don't fit in when that's what fitting in means.

Some clubs aren't worth the cost of admission.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Our fantasies are just reality without the downside.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Just because you feel like shit doesn't mean you need to act like shit, treat other people like shit, or treat yourself like shit.

I think separating our feelings from how we behave is a sign of maturity, which has almost nothing to do with how old you are, only how skilled.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
People will judge you for failing.
People will judge you for succeeding.
People will judge you for not trying.

Criticism is guaranteed.

So you might as well get criticized for going after what you want.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
More dreams die from a lack of courage than a lack of talent.
More dreams die from a lack of focus than a lack of talent.
More dreams die from a lack of toughness than a lack of talent.

Our dreams die not because of our lack of potential, but our lack of action despite it.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You must first become misunderstood before you can become great.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Most people die with 90% of their potential unused because they're unwilling to sacrifice their current self rather than their potential self.

vivesoy

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The only thing worse than breaking up with a bad  business partner is not breaking up with a bad business partner.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: When your world is crumbling around you, the only thing you can do is the work.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The older I get, the more I realize how few things you can do exceptionally well.

Which makes focusing, saying no, and ruthlessly prioritizing not a luxury but a requirement.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Friendly reminder that you can feel terrible, have terrible circumstances, and still make the right decision.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
In the early days...
Mind-numbing boredom.
Physical exhaustion.
Social discomfort.

All expected prices of admission.
Onwards.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
If we lose the details, we lose it all.

- Walt Disney

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
How to win:

Realize no one is coming to save you.
Take responsibility for your current position.
Be willing to sacrifice who you are for who you want to be.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You're right. You had it harder. You started with less. Bad things happened to you.

But believing those things limit you prevents you from becoming an example to everyone else like you.

Be the one who had it worse but still did better.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The fastest way to become confident is to build evidence.

Build yourself a stack of undeniable proof that you are who you say you are.

Do so much volume that you don't have time to doubt whether you can do it or not.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
It‚Äôs very hard to have a vision when you have bills to pay.

Fit for 55 - Explained

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Friendly reminder that feeling lost, anxious, and uncertain are good signs.

It means you‚Äôre pushing past what you know.

They‚Äôre called ‚Äúgrowing pains‚Äù for a reason.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The fastest way to change your life is to get around people whose minimum standards are your life goals.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Do the work tired. Do the work nervous. Do the work imperfectly. Do the work even when you don't feel like it.

Because no matter how bad you feel when you start, you know exactly how you'll feel when you finish.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You have to risk looking broke to get rich.
You have to risk looking weak to get strong.
You have to risk looking desperate to get loved.

Egos hold back more dreams than failure and rejection ever will.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Feeling stressed, angry, and frustrated isn‚Äôt the problem.

Letting stress, anger, and frustration stop you from doing the things you know you should be doing is the problem.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: In the infinite game of business, there are no winners or losers, only players and quitters.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
It takes every child a different amount of time to grow up and learn how to separate how they feel from how they act.

And some children never grow up. They just get older.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Deep down you already know what you should be doing.

Help more than you hate.
Create more than you complain.
Leave things better than you found them.

The secret to getting ahead is doing what everyone knows, but no one does.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Losers blame others to feel better.
Winners blame themselves to get better.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Most people die with 90% of their potential unused because they're afraid of sacrificing their current life rather than their potential life.

When you‚Äôre 85 years old and on your deathbed - you‚Äôre not gonna wish you played it ‚Äúsafe‚Äù.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You can‚Äôt say you want to be in the top .1% and not be willing to do things 999 out of 1000 aren‚Äôt.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Avoiding people who make it harder for you to achieve your goals is the highest form of self care.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You can't get rich if you never risk losing money.
You can't get loved if you never risk getting rejected.
You can't get strong if you never risk getting injured.

The price of the life you want is the risks you‚Äôre avoiding.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The best way to get new customers to do a really really really good job with your existing customers.

And if that doesn‚Äôt work, you didn‚Äôt put enough ‚Äúreally‚Äùs in front of ‚Äúgood job‚Äù.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The difference between your business and one 10x your size is: whatever big marketing push you‚Äôd make to launch something, they just do it all the time.

Volume negates luck.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The difference between who you say you are and who you really are is the work you do when people are looking compared to the work that no one sees.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The quality of my thinking is directly proportional to the quality of my sleep.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The whole point of marketing is one thing: to gain trust. Because once someone trusts you, you don‚Äôt need to do anything else besides keep it.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Do so much work it would be unreasonable that you don‚Äôt succeed.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
One of the most painful parts of entrepreneurship - that breaks most people - is when you have to suffer today for mistakes you would never make today but you made years ago, but come due with interest.

Sui

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
I know it‚Äôs hard for you to believe, but someone really can put in 10,000 times more work than you, but they can.

and that‚Äôs how than can achieve 10,000x the outcome.

output = volume x leverage

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You‚Äôre behind because you‚Äôre in a rush, and you‚Äôre in a rush because you feel behind. And you feel behind because you're in a different season than the people you're comparing yourself to.

You're not behind. You're just early.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The fastest way to change your life is to change your environment.

It's hard to become the best version of yourself when you're surrounded by people who are the worst version of themselves.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Switching strategies every month guarantees you'll always be a beginner.

Mastery comes from better, not new.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You already know what to do. You just haven‚Äôt done it enough times yet.

Success isn't some magic list nobody knows. It's an obvious list nobody does.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: "Beside death, all failure is psychological" - Jocko

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The difference between who you are and who you could be is the important and not urgent work you can't do on a meeting and can only do alone.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The most dangerous person in the world is the one who continues to show up every day even when the rewards are not guaranteed. Your potential is determined by the amount of uncertainty you‚Äôre able to tolerate and how long you can tolerate it for.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Most people die with 90% of their potential unused because they're afraid of a few years of hard conversations, working on stuff you have no idea how to do yet, and doing way more boring work than you thought you were capable of.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
If you want to live an exceptional life, then you can‚Äôt expect to take the same actions, live the same lifestyle, or tolerate the same standards as everyone else. By definition, you must be the exception.

Mutua Madrile√±a

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Your inability to work without reward for an extended period of time will hurt your potential far more than your lack of talent.

Before you can become exceptional, you must first become consistent.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Whenever I‚Äôm going through something hard, I try to ask myself:

‚ÄúWhat story do I want to tell at the end of this?‚Äù

And then try to act accordingly.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The easiest way to spot a novice is they optimize for optionality. They hop from opportunity to opportunity, always chasing the shiniest thing. But all the money is in going all in, not hedging your bets.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The size of your potential is determined by how many good opportunities you're willing to pass up while pursuing something great.

Tanda no recuardo cual:

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You can measure how successful a person will be by how they respond when things go wrong.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Relationship advice I‚Äôd give to my younger self:
- Pick someone you‚Äôd go to war with
- Judge off your worst days, not your best days
- Be willing to make trades (low expectations, high commitment)
- During fights, remember: you‚Äôre on the same team

author: Alex Hormozi
text: People underestimate how much effort it takes to stick with one thing rather than jumping to the next shiny opportunity every 6 months.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The person you want to become doesn‚Äôt entertain the opportunities you‚Äôre getting distracted by.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Reminder: Just because you feel like shit doesn't mean you need to act like shit, treat other people like shit, or treat yourself like shit.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: It takes everyone a different amount of time to realize the work never stops being hard, boring, and unsexy. You can dress it up or dress it down, but at the end of the day, the work still needs doing.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The price of wanting to be good at everything is being good at nothing.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If you add ‚Äú00‚Äù to the number of repetitions you think it‚Äôll take to get where you want, you‚Äôre on the right track.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If I‚Äôm feeling wild, sometimes I‚Äôll just call someone without texting them first.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
When selling to businesses, never worry about your price tag. Businesses aren‚Äôt price sensitive, they‚Äôre ROI sensitive. Focus on the return and the price & profit will take care of itself.

MAPFRE Espa√±a

author: Alex Hormozi
text: how long you mourn has no bearing on how much you loved

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Sometimes mental toughness isn‚Äôt about pushing harder, but choosing which pain is worth enduring.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The two favorite small moments of my day are:

1) when I do my top sets for legs, the world goes quiet.

2) when I put in my ear plugs just before going to sleep, the world goes quiet.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The simplest explanation for hiring a team:

You can outwork anyone but you can‚Äôt outwork everyone.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If it‚Äôs doable, then you can do it. There‚Äôs nothing more to winning than that.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You can change your entire bloodline the moment you realize: what you do next always matters more than what you did last.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
üíØ
Quote
Jeremy Giffon

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Never let unaccomplished people judge your accomplishments.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Messing up stuff that matters is the cost of figuring out things worth learning.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You can beat 99% of people if you can master the shame of rejection, the boredom of repetition, and pain of feedback.

Ribera Del Duero

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Nothing costs more in life than what you don‚Äôt know yet but should.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Do so much volume it would be unreasonable for you to fail.
Study each success and see what sets it apart from all the failures.
Repeat the winning parts even more times.
Don't change your mind before you let compounding - compound.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You don‚Äôt need a vision board to get rich.

Follow the law of action rather than the law of attraction.

Solve problems for other people that they value and can pay you more for, then do it as much or many times as possible.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
How to build a hugely valuable business:
"Find world class people and get out of their way."

The problem is, world class people dont want to work for you because you're not good enough, you have no track record, and they dont believe in your mission.

You work to deserve them.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The reason you don‚Äôt have what you want is because you're not doing enough, your standards are too low, and you haven't given time...time.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The fastest way to become successful is to associate with people more successful than you. This results in some of the fastest learning and behavior change you can experience.

The problem is...they wont want anything to do with you.

So you have to find ONE thing you're more

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The easiest way to get rich is you solve a problem that everyone has, but nobody wants to do.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
This quote fundamentally changed my life:

"To understand is to forgive" - Pascal

It's hard to hate someone up close. Including yourself.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You don't get what you deserve, you get what you decide you deserve. But you gotta decide.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
A path to living a life with no regrets.
Start with your eulogy and work backwards.
500 words shows you how most things matter little, and how the little things matter the most.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Most people are poor. Most people behave the same way. So the game of wealth is more about unlearning what everyone else does, then keeping what's left.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Inconvenience, inefficiency, and instability are the invisible taxes of poverty.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: To become more, you have to need less.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If you're willing to die for something, than you'll certainly be willing to work really hard for a long time for it. Which should explain why some people are willing to work 24/7 to make their dreams a reality and others aren't. It's not discipline - it's purpose. Some things are

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You cannot heal in the same environment that got you sick. If you can't change your environment, change your environment.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: There are some evils that can only be known once experienced - which is why humans keep making the same mistakes throughout history.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The cost of figuring it out is the amount of times you try and don‚Äôt.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Do whatever you have to do to get wherever you wanna go and don‚Äôt let anyone tell you you‚Äôre not good enough, your idea sucks, or it‚Äôs not gonna work.

They didn‚Äôt believe in their own ideas a long time ago. No reason for you to start believing in them now.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Eulogies typically only talk about two things:
1) Service
2) Character
If we begin with the end in mind, it tells us that we should spend our time solving hard problems to serve others - and in so doing - become the person worthy of solving them.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
The earlier you start, the less you have to lose and the more you have to gain by taking your shot.

When you start out with nothing, you have the one that matters most: the highest risk to return ratio possible. Nothing to lose. Everything to gain.

It never gets better. Shoot.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The skepticism, doubt, and pushback you get from your friends & family when you start is just preparation for the thousands of strangers who will do that for you once you succeed.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: No matter what your goal is, you will suffer to achieve it. So pick a goal big enough it‚Äôs worth suffering for.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: We all become like the people we expose ourselves to. You just get to choose which parts.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You'll learn 100x more about an enemy if you ignore 100% of what they say and just look at where they spend their time and their money. The rest is deception.

This also applies to friends.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: If you keep at it long enough, luck becomes skill.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You have absolutely no obligation to explain yourself to people who don't want you to win.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You are not obligated to give anyone a second chance.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
If you always feel like a victim, it‚Äôs probably because the main character in your story is someone else.

La Sagrada Fam√≠lia

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
There are two success paths in life:

1) Do nothing. Want nothing.
2) Pick a direction and ride the chaos as long as you can until nature finds your equal.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You can get a surprisingly good personal life map - without of the influence of others - by simply thinking about what you want said at your funeral then reversing it into the present.

It's an astonishingly strong razor for cutting the bullshit out of your life.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
You'll never eat a meal so big you never need to eat again.
You'll never sleep so good you never need to sleep again.
You'll never accomplish so big, you'll never dream again.

There's nothing wrong with you: satisfaction is always temporary.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: It's amazing how much you can accomplish if you start without needing anyone else's opinion.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The biggest decisions you make in your life are actually deciding who gets to influence your decision making.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
This always gets me:

What are you so afraid of losing when nothing in this world belongs to you?

-Marcus Aurelius

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
They‚Äôre not mad at you. They‚Äôre just taking it out on you.

Big difference.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: What you want most is worth risking it for.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: Everyone starts as a victim - some people stay there longer than others. And some people never stop.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
My mother died in an unexpected accident at her home on Friday night in Baltimore.
I want to take a brief moment to honor her life.

She was admitted into the first ever female class at John‚Äôs Hopkins (a huge accomplishment, because before that, it was men only).

She ran a

author: Alex Hormozi
text: You probably don't need smaller goals, just fewer.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: There is no benefit to talking about problems you cannot solve. Sometimes you just need to get kicked in the nuts and move on.

author: Alex Hormozi
text: The difference between a smart person and a dumb person isn't whether they make a mistake or not, but how many times they need to repeat the same one to learn.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
Three non obvious things I look for with talent:
1) Did my life get easier/quieter since they came in?
2) Do they take things on without being asked?
3) Can they think past first order consequences?

author: Alex Hormozi
text: It‚Äôs hard to beat a man who feels he deserves nothing but is willing to endure anything.

author: Alex Hormozi
text:
If you‚Äôre not making money, it‚Äôs because:

You don‚Äôt know how to solve a valuable problem.
Or
You can but no one knows about you.

That's it.
